Package org.activebpel.rt.bpel.def.io.registry

This package contains the registry classes for accessing readers and writers for BPEL and extension elements.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
IAeBpelRegistry Interface for retrieving AeDef object serializers and deserializers.
IAeDefReaderRegistry Defines a Def reader registry.
IAeDefWriterRegistry Defines a Def Writer Registry.
 

Class Summary
AeAbstractBpelRegistry An abstract base class for BPEL registries.
AeBPWSBpelRegistry Default impl of the IAeBpelRegistry.
AeBPWSDefReaderRegistry BPEL4WS registry for mapping BPEL elements to the appropriate deserializer.
AeBPWSDefWriterRegistry This impl simply maps the AeDef class object to its associated writer.
AeBPWSDefWriterRegistry.AeSkipWriter A bpel def writer that will skip the creation of an element and instead return the parent element.
AeWSBPELAbstractProcessBpelRegistry Registry implementation for WS BPEL 2.0 abstract processes.
AeWSBPELAbstractProcessDefReaderRegistry An implementation of the Def Reader Registry for WS-BPEL 2.0 Abstract processes.
AeWSBPELAbstractProcessDefWriterRegistry A WSBPEL 2.0 Abstract process's implementation of a Def Writer Registry.
AeWSBPELBpelRegistry A WSBPEL 2.0 implementation of the bpel registry.
AeWSBPELDefReaderRegistry An implementation of the Def Reader Registry for WS-BPEL 2.0.
AeWSBPELDefWriterRegistry A WSBPEL 2.0 implementation of a Def Writer Registry.
 

Package org.activebpel.rt.bpel.def.io.registry Description

This package contains the registry classes for accessing readers and writers for BPEL and extension elements.
The IAeBpelRegistry provides access to all of the readers and writers associated with standard BPEL (1.1) elements. Readers are accessed by providing the class of the parent AeBaseDef object and the QName of the current element. This allows different readers to mapped to elements with the same QName but different parent classes. Writers follow the same pattern.
NOTE: In the current impl, the writer parent class is ignored as there are no custom writers based on parent class differences. Also, the interfaces do not expose any way to register custom readers/writers at runtime - custom registry classes should be provided.
The IAeExtensionRegistry provides programmatic access for registering custom extension readers/writers. By default, the registry has a default reader/writer installed to handle all extension elements in a generic fashion.
